summary: Lymphangiosarcoma is a rare cancer that occurs in long-standing cases of primary or secondary lymphedema, typically in the upper or lower extremities. It is believed to arise from endothelial cells and may be more accurately referred to as angiosarcoma.
risk_factors: Post-mastectomy status (especially >5 years survival with severe lymphedema)
symptoms: Tender skin nodule in the extremity
Extensive necrotic focus involving skin and subcutaneous tissue
treatments: Chemotherapy (if metastatic disease is suspected or present)
